p: Kyasanur Forest Disease Virus (KFDV; family Flaviviridae, genus Flavivirus) causes debilitating and fatal haemorrhagic disease (around 500 cases p.a., up to 10% mortality[ 25]) in forest communities. Key affected groups include small-holder farmers engaged in cultivation and grazing of cattle in forests [ 26], forest-dependent tribal communities who gather NTFP, day labourers in plantations and State forest department workers[ 27â€“ 29].
